intro: Miconia ferreyrae, commonly known as the Ferreyra's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, showy leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
